title: GameStop, BlackBerry, Kimberly-Clark: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
sub_head: Technology shares were leading gains premarket
body:
Here’s what we’re watching ahead of Monday’s opening bell.
—U.S. stock futures overall were little changed though technology shares charged higher ahead of a blockbuster week in earnings, with investors awaiting results from companies such as  Apple ,   Tesla and  Facebook .
Futures tied to the S&P 500 edged down less than 0.1% while contracts linked to the Nasdaq-100 advanced 0.9%.
—Earnings are due from Steel Dynamics and Hexcel after the close.
—The World Economic Forum holds a virtual summit this week. Chinese President Xi Jinping‘s speech at 7 a.m. ET highlights today’s agenda. Monday’s panels include European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde on restoring economic growth at 11 a.m., and Bank of England Gov. Andrew Bailey on digital currencies at 12 p.m.
